results.title: Sand paintings of the Western Desert: a demonstration (A)
results.creator_credit: Stephen O'Rourke, Penelope Jools and ABC-TV (Australia)
results.brief_description: Aboriginal artists, Paddy Garrol Tjungarrayi and Dinni Nolan Tjampatimpa, demonstrate the making of a sandpainting - a traditional art form intended to be impermanent. The paintings are made in a ritual manner and then destroyed as they are danced upon during a corroboree. Shows the adaptation of western technology by the Papunya people to this traditional art form.

results.title: Sand dunes: An introduction
results.creator_credit: David Walton and Anvil Films and Record Group
results.brief_description: Begins by illustrating the formation of a sand dune and goes on to show how plant life becomes established. The animals population is also examined. From the series “Basic Ecology”.

results.title: Sand casting: an art adventure
results.creator_credit: Bill Mackie, Easy Street Productions and Centron Films
results.brief_description: Shows a young woman and several children making sand casts of several objects. The adult demonstrator shows the step by step procedure for making and decorating plaster of paris castings using inexpensive materials. Suitable for upper primary level.

results.title: Sand and flame
results.brief_description: Open with a survey of the development of glass-making and the art of the early glass-blower. Shows manufacture of wide range of glass products, including the automatic bottle-making process; manufacture of fine glass tubing; transformation of glass marbles into glass fibre; production of glass bricks; furnacing, rolling, cutting, grinding and polishing of plate glass; manufacture of shatter-proof plate glass.

results.title: San Junipero
results.brief_description: When Yorkie and Kelly visit San Junipero, a fun-loving beach town full of surf, sun and sex, their lives are changed in this acclaimed episode of Black Mirror.

constellations_other.name: VR dreams
constellations_other.description: Since VR's inception creators have explored the ways VR could be used to enhance our lives and even extend them.

results.title: San Francisco; Hollywood; Beverly Hills
results.brief_description: Hang ten at Huntington Beach or take a ski run at Big Bear. Discover history preserved in landmarks and revel in world renowned performing arts. See the vast variety of California’s lifestyle cities. Explore the hills and valleys of San Francisco: ride a trolley car, explore the Barbary Coast, enjoy museums, opera, symphony and distinguished cuisine on Fisherman’s Wharf. Travel to the bustling mega-tropolis Los Angeles and tour the infamous Beverly Hills and Hollywood, home to the rich and famous. Marvel at the sites and sounds of southern California - at the regions natural beauty from beaches to desert to snow-capped mountains. All without leaving your own lounge chair!

results.title: San Francisco: city at the end of the rainbow
results.brief_description: This travelogue takes the viewer on a tour of San Francisco to discover the curious and unusual facets of the city. Among the many attractions of San Francisco is a cable car ride to Fisherman’s Wharf, Alcatraz, one of the city’s most eeriest attractions, the Columbus Day Parade and the fascinating spectacle of fog rolling in over the city. Take a trip along the Golden Gate Bridge and never leave your armchair.

results.title: San Francisco Bay Area Rapid Transit: conflict with Berkeley
results.brief_description: The basis of the conflict between BART (Bay Area Rapid Transport) and the Berkley Community was whether tracks, for a kind of railway, should be placed over or under ground. The mayor of the time and some other people explain how the fight was conducted and the strategies of BART and Berkeley and the final victory for Berkeley.

results.title: San Francisco
results.creator_credit: W S. Van Dyke, Bernard H. Hyman, John Emerson and Metro-Goldwyn-Mayer
results.brief_description: A lavish production set in San Francisco, in which Clark Gable plays the role of Blackie Norton, proprietor of a riotous saloon. When Jeanette MacDonald arrives on the scene in search of a singing career, they fall in love. The climax takes place amongst the recreation of the great earthquake that hit the city in 1906. Cast also includes Spencer Tracy, Jack Holt, Jessie Ralph and Ted Healy. Screenplay by Anita Loos from the story by Robert Hopkins. Edited by Tom Neld.

results.title: San Andreas fault
results.creator_credit: Bert Van Bork, American Geological Institute and Encyclopaedia Britannica Films
results.brief_description: Presents evidence of geological forces at work relating to the causes of earthquakes. Describes the scientific methods used to study current seismic activity in the San Andreas Fault in California.
